intro: Pleiotaxis overlaetii, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and succulent, helping it conserve water in its native habitat. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
